page.title: 04WOMERSLEY VILLAGE HALL.
page.content: Womersley Hall stands immediately adjacent to Saint Martins church and at first sight appears to be an 18th century building. The central block however is a much older structure, and traces of mullianed windows of the Tudor era are still to be seen in the basement, and the side of the stable entrance which may originally have been the gate tower of the ancient hall. Now it is no longer being used by anybody and it is slowly falling apart .However, the gardens are still used by the craft centre at Womersley for growing herbs and flowers which are dried out to make decorative basketware and herbal remedies. The hall itself, and the things grown there,and used for the Craft Centre,will be of interest to visitors to the village.
